prompt: For our Casimir system to have a value of $D^{(1)}=0$ on both plates we need an infinite set of image sources placed at a distance of $z=\pm2an$ for integer $n$ for each plate. Placing the images at a spacing of $a$ locates a source on each plate, and cause double placement of sources at each point along the $z$ axis. This doubling of the boundary terms translates into an extra factor of $2$ on the numerator of the boundary term for the Hadamard function.
